name: openldap-admin
description:
phpLDAPadmin is a web-based LDAP client. It provides easy, anywhere-accessible, multi-language administration for your LDAP server.

This DC/OS package is ready to be used alongside the DC/OS `openldap` package. Other LDAP servers may work, but haven't been tested.
preInstallNotes:
Open LDAP Admin requires at least 0.1 CPU and 128MB of RAM.

WARNING: OpenLDAP Admin on DCOS is currently EXPERIMENTAL. There may be bugs, incomplete features, incorrect documentation, or other discrepancies.

This package will automatically connect to an existing DC/OS `openldap` package through an automated Virtual IP.

This package is accessible through the DC/OS `Services` tab. If the `external_access` installation option is selected, it will also create an entry in the Marathon-LB external load balancer for accessing the UI from outside the cluster, by default in port `11389` . Access the UI at `http://your_DCOS_URL/services/openldapadmin`, or if `external_access` is selected, also at `http://your_public_node_ip:11389`.
postInstallNotes:
OpenLDAP Admin has been installed.

You can now access the UI at `http://your_DCOS_URL/services/openldapadmin` or at `http://your_public_node_ip:11389` (if external_access was selected)

DC/OS openldap default Login DN: `cn=admin,dc=example,dc=org`
Default password: `admin`
postUninstallNotes: OpenLDAP Admin has been uninstalled. Note that any data persisted to a NFS share still exists and will need to be manually removed.
